title.narrative: Removal of Barriers to Solar P

description.narrative: Removal of Barriers to Solar PV Power Generation in Mauritius, Rodrigues and the Outer Islands
independent political entity

Capacity available to upgrade existing solar radiation data expand geographical coverage for solar resource measurement formulate solar map technical guidelines and standards for and provide oversight monitoring and certification of PV systems and provide installation operation maintenance and repair services Necessary technology transfer models formulated and operationalised

Teams trained in various categories of activities
Guidelines and technical standards for ongrid PV systems
Technology delivery models put in place

comment.narrative: No such activity being implemented

15 sites targeted for enhanced solar radiation assessment in year 1
Published guidelines and technical standards within 15 months of project start
Manual for installation operation maintenance and repair services developed by year 15 40 people trained in the various categories by the end of the project

The projectcommissioned Mercados report on grid absorption grid code and ESPA and FIT etc has addressed the issue of guidelines and technical standards However the MidTerm Review MTR advised that with regard to solar map preparation it is better to have a consultancy to devise a roadmap for the solar map since the available data from the MET office is not of good quality Consultations have now commenced with the University of Mauritius to assist with the solar mapping

15 sites targeted for enhanced solar radiation assessment in year 1
Published guidelines and technical standards within 15 months of project start
Manual for installation operation maintenance and repair services developed by year 15 40 people trained in the various categories by the end of the project

The projectcommissioned Mercados report on grid absorption grid code and ESPA and FIT etc has addressed the issue of guidelines and technical standards However the MidTerm Review MTR advised that with regard to solar map preparation it is better to have a consultancy to devise a roadmap for the solar map since the available data from the MET office is not of good quality Consultations have now commenced with the University of Mauritius to assist with the solar mapping

Onestop shop is operational

All construction licenses and permits are issued following completion of feasibility studies and selection of promoters

description.narrative: Programme for upgrading existing solar radiation data expand geographical coverage for solar resource measurement Publication of a solar Map for Mauritius Rodrigues and the Outer Islands

Instrumentation to measure solar radiation data installed
Software developed for interpretation of data
Solar map developed and published

comment.narrative: Presently available solar radiation data insufficient to accurately design ongrid PV systems

Upgradeexpand coverage to 15 sites completed by the end of project
Four Meteorological Services staff trained within first 15 months of project
As per a recommendation of the MidTerm Review the project team is working on a TOR for the preparation of a road map for the development of the Solar Map

description.narrative: Promoters assisted financially through Feed in Tariffs and projects implemented and supplying electricity to the CEB grid
Funding used for topping up part of the price differential in feedin tariffs for a determined time

comment.narrative: Not presently available
Construction of at least 3 MW of ongrid PV systems completed by the end of the project

10 MW of PPAs have been signed following a competitive tendering process Therefore an initial payment has been made to the Central Electricity Board CEB to boost its capacity to pay as soon as the PV farms come into operation
Construction of at least 3 MW of ongrid PV systems completed by the end of the project

description.narrative: To assist the Government in addressing the barriers with a view to promoting PV gridconnected electricity generation
Direct investment in at least 3 MW of ongrid PV installations by end of project Amount of reduced CO2 emissions compared to the projected baseline

comment.narrative: GHG in the electricity generation sector scheduled to increase from 203 million tonsyear 2008 figures to almost 33 million tonsyear by the year 2020

11662 2 MWh of electricity generated as a result of the 3 MW capacity brought online by project completion
Direct reduction of 13295 tons of CO2 over the 4year FSP project life cycle and 98400 over the full lifetime of the plants
Estimated cumulative indirect GHG emission reduction of at least 350000 tons of CO2eq by 2025 on the basis of a conservative policy scenario and a GEF causality factor of 80

17 MW of PV have been installed as a result of an additional private promoters 15 MW installation coming into operation and around 2 MW of SmallScale Distributed Generation SSDG Therefore direct emission reductions are estimated to be 9928 ktonnes of CO2
